book.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide To The Galaxy
book.description: It's an ordinary Thursday lunchtime for Arthur Dent until his house gets demolished. The Earth follows shortly afterwards to make way for a new hyperspace bypass and his best friend has just announced that he's an alien.

book.title: Watership Down
book.description: Set in southern England, the story features a small group of rabbits.

book.title: The Five People You Meet in Heaven
book.description: It follows the life and death of a maintenance man named Eddie.

book.title: Speak
book.description: After accidentally busting an end-of-summer party due to an unnamed incident, Melinda is ostracized by her peers because she will not say why she called the police.

book.title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
book.description: A coming-of-age story that illustrates how strength of character and a love of literature can help overcome racism and trauma.

book.title: Thirteen Reasons Why
book.description: Clay Jensen, a shy high school student, returns home from school one day to find that he has received a mysterious package in the mail.

book.title: Foundation Series
book.description: The premise of the series is that the mathematician Hari Seldon spent his life developing a branch of mathematics known as psychohistory, a concept of mathematical sociology.

book.title: The Sisterhood of the Travelling Pants
book.description: Four best friends spend their first summer apart and keep in touch with each other by mailing each other a pair of jeans which, despite their varying body shapes, magically fit them all perfectly.

book.title: A Great and Terrible Beauty
book.description: Gemma leaves her home in India to go to a boarding school in England after her mother dies. Once there, she is plagued by clairvoyant visions as she looks into the magical secrets of the school

book.title: The Da Vinci Code
book.description: The curator of the Louvre is murdered, leaving behind a chain of obscure clues to a world-changing secret.

book.title: The Princess Diaries
book.description: An ordinary girl suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess.

book.title: Ender's Game
book.description: Set in Earth's future, the novel presents an imperiled mankind after two conflicts with the "buggers", an insectoid alien species.

book.title: The Hunt for Red October
book.description: In 1984, the USSR's best submarine captain in their newest sub violates orders and heads for the USA. Is he trying to defect, or to start a war?

book.title: The Hunger Games
book.description: A dystopia set in Panem, a country consisting of the wealthy Capitol and 12 districts in varying states of poverty. Every year, children from the districts are selected to participate in a compulsory annual televised death match.

book.title: The Great Gatsby
book.description: The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession for the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

book.title: Ranger's Apprentice Series
book.description: The series follows the adventures of Will, an orphan who is taken as an apprentice Ranger, as he strives to keep the Kingdom of Araluen safe from invaders, traitors, and threats.

book.title: Inkheart
book.description: Meggie, a girl at the age of 12, sees a stranger staring at her outside her window and tells her father, who invites the stranger in.

book.title: Neuromancer
book.description: Henry Dorsett Case is a low-level hustler in the dystopian underworld of Chiba City, Japan.

book.title: Lord of the Flies
book.description: The book's premise focuses on a group of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island and their attempt to govern themselves, with disastrous results.

book.title: The Princess Bride
book.description: A pirate sets out to rescue his childhood sweetheart from a gang of kidnappers and an evil prince.

book.title: Dinotopia: A Land Apart from Time
book.description: Dinotopia is an isolated island inhabited by shipwrecked humans and sentient dinosaurs who have learned to coexist peacefully as a single symbiotic society.

book.title: Far North
book.description: What began as a sightseeing detour turns into a survival mission for two high-school students and their elderly companion.

book.title: Practical Magic
book.description: For more than two hundred years, the Owens women have been blamed for everything that has gone wrong in their Massachusetts town.

book.title: Brave New World
book.description: Set in London in the year AD 2540, the novel anticipates developments in reproductive technology, sleep-learning, psychological manipulation, and classical conditioning that combine profoundly to change society.

book.title: The Summer Tree
book.description: The five main characters attend a lecture by a Professor Lorenzo Marcus, who afterwards reveals to them that he is in reality Loren Silvercloak, a mage from the land of Fionavar.

book.title: Flowers For Algernon
book.description: Flowers for Algernon is the beloved, classic story of a mentally disabled man whose experimental quest for intelligence mirrors that of Algernon, an extraordinary lab mouse.

book.title: Owl in Love
book.description: Part bird of prey, part teenage girl in love, and now part stalker, Owl Tycho's life is complicated.

book.title: Naruto
book.description: It tells the story of Naruto Uzumaki, an adolescent ninja who searches constantly for recognition and dreams of becoming the Hokage, the ninja in his village who is acknowledged as the leader and the strongest of all.

book.title: Bleach (graphic novel)
book.description: Bleach follows the adventures of the hotheaded teenager Ichigo Kurosaki who inherits his parents destiny, after he obtains the powers of a Soul Reaper.

book.title: Kiss the Dust
book.description: A novel on the conflicts between the Kurds and the then Saddam Hussein-led Iraqis.

book.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
book.description: The narrator's father, Atticus Finch, has served as a moral hero for many readers and as a model of integrity for lawyers.

book.title: The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe
book.description: It's the first published and best known of seven novels in The Chronicles of Narnia.

book.title: The Bourne Series
book.description: A series of action spy thrillers based on the character Jason Bourne, a CIA assassin suffering from extreme memory loss who must figure out who he is.

book.title: Life of Pi
book.description: A teenage boy faces a fight for survival when he is stranded aboard a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

book.title: Breathless
book.description: Travis Morrison is a champion diver. On the first day of summer vacation, while boating on the lake with his friends, Travis attempts a silly stunt dive that goes wrong.

book.title: Twilight Series
book.description: Twilight is a series of four vampire-themed fantasy romance novels.

book.title: Sabriel
book.description: The novel is set in two neighbouring fictional countries: To the South lies Ancelstierre, which has a technology level and society similar to that of early-20th century, and to the North lies the Old Kingdom, where both Free magic and Charter Magic exist.

book.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four (1984)
book.description: The novel is set in Airstrip One, a province of the superstate Oceania in a world of perpetual war, omnipresent government surveillance, and public manipulation.

book.title: Eragon
book.description: Fifteen-year-old Eragon believes that he is merely a poor farm boy- until his destiny as a Dragon Rider is revealed.

book.title: Hatchet

book.title: My Sister's Keeper
book.description: The idyllic family life of Sara and Brian is torn apart when their young daughter falls ill and needs a compatible bone-marrow donor.

book.title: The Golden Compass
book.description: A young girl embarks on a perilous journey to rescue her best friend and fight the forces of darkness.

book.title: Harry Potter Series
book.description: The novels chronicle the life of a young wizard, Harry Potter, and his friends Hermione Granger and Ron Weasley, all of whom are students at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

book.title: Holes
book.description: The boys are digging holes because the warden is looking for something. But what could be buried under a dried-up lake?

book.title: Shonen Jump Series
book.description: There are currently twenty-one manga titles being serialized in Weekly Shonen Jump.

book.title: The Shadow Club
book.description: Two middle school students, Jared Mercer and Cheryl Gannett, see themselves as the "second best" students in their school at the activities that they do best, and find the worst possible way to get revenge on those better than them.

book.title: Bone Series
book.description: The comic book series centers on the Bone cousins, white, bald cartoon caricatures

book.title: Maus: A Survivor's Tale
book.description: A graphice novel that depicts the author interviewing his father about his experiences as a Polish Jew and Holocaust survivor.

book.title: The Joy Luck Club
book.description: Bestseller about four immigrant Chinese women and their American-born daughters.

book.title: The Lord of the Rings
book.description: Epic fantasy novel set in Middle Earth.

book.title: The Hobbit
book.description: Fantasy novel that follows the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins.

book.title: The War Of The Worlds
book.description: One of the earliest stories that detail a conflict between mankind and an extraterrestrial race.

book.title: Dealing with Dragons
book.description: Princess Cimorene escapes her tediously ordinary family to be a dragon's princess.

book.title: The Chrysalids
book.description: An undetermined number of years into the future, post-apocalypse rural Labrador has become a warmer and more hospitable place than it is at present.
